text: and A1, B2 we'll run it, 3 came because this time A was also number and B was also number here we have a lot of complaints we can't see it, we can't see it, we can't see it now we can see it, it's big now so what is typecasting? I have written it here the conversion of one data type into the other data type is known as typecasting in python or type conversion Python also calls it this way Python supports a lot of functions, not about data types but about functions, int, str, ord, hex, oct, tuple, set, list, dict these are all methods these are all data types this is a function that helps any other data type to convert into these data types now it will try to convert now you'll say convert harry into integer how to convert? harry is written, it's a name convert it into integer yes if one is written in your string then it's understandable that one is a string, not a string, make one a number I understand that, but what is this? make harry a number harry gets angry and gets angry he says, do you want to convert harry into a number? you can't do it there are two types of typecasting, but before that I'll tell you the basic typecasting suppose I say I don't want to make a number I want to do it with this suppose I have a string, b string, and I say it suppose something like this happens add int of a and int of b so 12 doesn't come then it does it first, then convert it into integer then convert b into integer, convert a into integer, convert b into integer and make 1 and 2 as a number
